Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.controller

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.controller.Controller
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observer<ClientEvent>
public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
implements Observer<ClientEvent>
The controller is the bridge between the network and the model. It observes the clients' events and communicates with them thanks to the server.

  • Constructor Details

    • Controller

      public Controller​(Match model, java.util.List<ServerView> playersInGame)

  • Method Details

    • handleActionValidation

      public void handleActionValidation​(Action action, int x, int y)
      Verifies that the action extracted from the clientEvent is valid on the model; if it is not, then it notifies the client. If the selection is not valid, it throws an exception and notifies the client. Called when WorkerSelectionQuestionEvent is received
      Parameters:
      action - Action chosen by the client.
      x - x coordinate of the action to perform with the selected worker.
      y - y coordinate of the action to perform with the selected worker.

    • handleSelectionWorker

      public void handleSelectionWorker​(int x, int y)
      Manages the WorkerSelectionQuestionEvent of the current playing client. If the selection is not valid, it throws an exception and notifies the client.
      Parameters:
      x - x coordinate of the chosen worker
      y - y coordinate of the chosen worker

    • handleMove

      public void handleMove​(int x, int y)
      Manages the move to perform with the selected worker on the board, after receiving the corresponding event. If the move is not valid, it throws an exception and notifies the client through the server.
      Parameters:
      x - x coordinate to move the worker onto
      y - y coordinate to move the worker onto

    • handleBuild

      public void handleBuild​(int x, int y)
      Manages the build to perform with the selected worker on the board, after receiving the corresponding event. If the move is not valid, it throws an exception and notifies the client through the server.
      Parameters:
      x - x coordinate to build on
      y - y coordinate to build on

    • nextActionHandler

      public void nextActionHandler()
      Called at the end of every action. It creates a map of the available actions with the possible tiles of these. If the map is not empty, it sends the player the map; otherwise it ends their turn, notifying them and starting the next turn.

    • handleStartNextTurn

      public void handleStartNextTurn()
      Called at the beginning of the game or at the end of a player's turn. It move the reference in the model to the next player and checks if this one has lost. If they lost, it calls manageLoser(), otherwise it tells the player that it is their turn.

    • manageLoser

      public void manageLoser()
      Called when there is a losing condition. If there are two remaining players, the last one is declared victorious. The losing player is removed from all the list they were inserted into and their ping flow is interrupted (see ServerView.stopPing())

    • disconnectAll

      public void disconnectAll()
      Handles the disconnection of a player and disconnects the others. Caused by DisconnectionEvent

    • handleDisconnection

      public void handleDisconnection​(java.lang.String player)
      Handles the disconnection of a player and disconnects the others
      Parameters:
      player - Player disconnecting

    • startGame

      public void startGame​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> gameDivinities, java.lang.String startPlayer)
      Called after DivinitiesInGameSelectionEvent is received and the map containing the divinities is no longer of size zero (the user correctly picked the divinities). It retrieves the information of the divinities through XMLParserUtility, it sends to every client the details regaring the game (usernames, colors for each player, divinities to choose and their description). Eventually it sends the starting player a DivinityInitializationEvent
      Parameters:
      gameDivinities - List of divinities equal in number to the number of players
      startPlayer - Username of the player that will begin.

    • getStartPlayer

      public int getStartPlayer()

    • getPlayersInGame

      public java.util.List<ServerView> getPlayersInGame()

    • getPlayersUsernames

      public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getPlayersUsernames()

    • getCurrentPlayerId

      public int getCurrentPlayerId()

    • setStartPlayer

      public void setStartPlayer​(java.lang.String player)

    • handleDivinityInitialization

      public void handleDivinityInitialization​(java.lang.String divinity)
      Maps the divinity chosen by the player and the player on the model. It updated the list of the available divinities removing the specified divinity; if the list reaches the size of one, the remaining divinity is paired with the remaining player and the game skips to the worker placement after informing the players' with the others' choice of the divinity. See DivinitiesSetupEvent Called when a DivinitySelectionEvent is received.
      Parameters:
      divinity - Name of the divinity chosen by a player

    • handleWorkerPlacementInitialization

      public void handleWorkerPlacementInitialization​(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
      Places a player's worker on the Board. If the player places the workers wrongly, an exception is thrown and they have to choose again. After each player placed their workers the game start (see Match.workerPlacementInitialization(int, int, int, int) Called when a WorkersPlacementSelectionEvent is received
      Parameters:
      x1 - first x coordinate
      y1 - first y coordinate
      x2 - second x coordinate
      y2 - second y coordinate

    • update

      public void update​(ClientEvent event)
      Extracts the information from the ClientEvent which will call a method on the controller.
      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer<ClientEvent>
      Parameters:
      event - Event from the client.
